Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, 4+*ish”
Reviews.Author: WhiteCloud_1912
Reviews.Content: My accommodation was paid for and so I can't comment on the price or value for money. However, I was very happy with the room - a double standard on the 7th floor, the top floor of guest rooms - which was very clean, quiet and comfortable. So much of Dubai is new, & I'm guessing that the Dhow Palace is one of the older hotels as there was evidence of wear and tear in the room but not to a degree that I would adversly comment. The cleaning staff were cheerful, very polite and did an excellent job. All I ever watch on TV is the BBC news channel which was there. The air-con was effective (too effective at times!) and easily adjusted. Our visit was in February and so the temperature was comfortable in Dubai. I suspect that when it hits 50 in summer the air-con is extremely important. The management staff were efficient and helpful without being overly friendly. The couple of small things we needed doing (opening the room safe left locked by the previous guest & replacing a bulb) were attended to immediately. The travel desk is helpful and tickets bought there appear to be the same price as when dealing direct with a tour/activity company. Breakfast was a buffet with a large variety of options, hot & cold, catering for european and asian tastes; the sort of offering that could find you putting on pounds if not careful. The staff, in their sailor themed uniforms, were very attentive, removing used plates etc. as soon as they were finished with. There are several resturants on the ground floor but we only ate in on one evening and used the hotel's main resturant which was, again, a buffet of considerable choice. Our trip was for business and pleasure and some of the time we were using one or two of the numerous business suites which were pretty busy every day. These facilities were good and the coffee and lunchtime refreshments were excellent. Although not in the centre of town and a little way from most of 'the sights', taxis in Dubai are cheap and plentiful and if using a standard taxi (as opposed to a hotel limmo) all are metered and the clock starts at Dh 3.50 - my fares never topped Dh30 (Dh5.4 to 1GBP at the time of travel). Taxis are pretty much always waiting outside. In short a good hotel which I would happily return to and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to lovely places like the Dubai Mall, World Trade Centre”
Reviews.Author: Femorata
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, courteous staff, several good restaurants for in hotel dining, clean rooms, good mix of TV programmes, good accessibility to major places of tourist interest.

Reviews.Title: “This is like again a 3.5star hotel which I can rate”
Reviews.Author: manny m
Reviews.Content: good side of the hotel a) the hotel from the exterior and interior looks very charming b) the rooms are also well decorated c) the variety of break fast is really wide and big which I enjoyed very much. d) all facilities of the hotel are working and in good condition e) the hotel staff is friendly f) the location is quite a central location. The bad side of the hotel a)the cost and method in which the wifi facility in the hotel operated is totaly unfair and very expensive. b) getting a taxi outside the hotel you really have to wait for 15 mins minimum and the hotel staff does not help you in arranging one. They only have car rental service for full day or to go across dubaifor half or full day. c) the laundry/housekeeping when dialed to opt the service take a lot of time to pick call and give in to your enquiry only after 20 min till then youvhave to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Stu-Charl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and booked the hotel via booking.com. Upon checkin the reception staff would not honour the rate and were determined not to discuss it. For an international hotel the checkin desk staff do not have good enough English and have an objectionable attitude. The rooms are clean although I booked a twin suite and had to make do with a standard room due to the checkin staff being not the best. My room key stopped working and checkin made me try 4 more before they called an engineer. All very frustrating. The is a really good Chinese within the restaurant with some fab staff. Overall ok but disappointed mainly down to checkin desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Aangan Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Sreelaks
Reviews.Content: This restaurant serves some good Indian dishes with some okay Indian music! The ambiance is good so is the variety of food items offered. The service is warm and friendly. The portion sizes are on a bigger side; so keep an eye on what you order unless you want to waste the food. We loved the Tandoori Jhinga which was of succulent tiger prawns.

Reviews.Title: “Aangan Indian Restaurant at the Dhow Palace”
Reviews.Author: spartaBristol
Reviews.Content: This was always our favourite Indian restaurant in Dubai. Previously their Lamb Shank was a truly spectacular dish, recommended by Time Out and we made an effort to go to the Dhow Palace Hotel on every visit to Dubai simply to go the the Aangan and have their lamb shanks. They also had a great Indian band playing most nights. How it has changed! On our last trip in Dec 2011, the first mouthful of the lamb shank told us something had changed. Now it was just a below average dish. A band was playing, but not good and way to load. I don;t go to a restaurant to just hear a band, but to engage in conversation. Completely impossible, I was shouting at my wife to make myself heard. It turns out the chef, the band and the manager has changed - all not for the better. Unfortunately, my advice on this restaurant has changed from 'must go' to 'Avoid'.

Reviews.Title: “almost a five star luxury”
Reviews.Author: ishan1988
Reviews.Content: dhow palace hotel is a superb hotel with free transportation to and fro dubai airport. it has a very good sheikh zayed road view with the view of sky scrappers building and the burj khalifa view. it has good restaurants and food inside .

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: MoIT186299
Reviews.Content: Every night, there was noise from the downstairs club to 0200; not great when you need to give a lecture the next day. Internet was expensive and poor reliability. Breakfast was OK. About 15 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station - Ok in december but would not be great at other times of the year. The reception was inefficient and unfriendly

Reviews.Title: “nice but far from down town”
Reviews.Author: solid61
Reviews.Content: the room was big with good and nice furniture . nice restaurant with good foods. not clean as i expect. some staffs wasn't kind. far from center of city and metro station. interesting night clubs.

Reviews.Title: “good for one night”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBazz
Reviews.Content: we got this place coming back from goa ..late one night,,at the dubai air port booking office for hotels it was all thay had left and at about 129 pound for the night,,well,,,,the mini bar was soon cleared when i did not leave a dep for the drinks,at booking in desk,,and at about a tenner for a small brandy,ect,,,for it was just as well, may have ended up washing up,,in the morrning, to pay,, ,the bed was very big,,,but smell very strong of some washing per,,...and thay need a window cleaner thay were very mucky,,,english breakfast a tenner,,and a big line of people waiting for it,,whent down the road got it for 7 pound,,, some thai,,place,now i know what,,beef bacon tastes like,aaa ,dont know what was in the sos,,just as well maybe,,

Reviews.Title: “Good food”
Reviews.Author: Janesh24
Reviews.Content: Had food in one of the restuarants in Dhow and our experience was very good. Good service. Try any item of paneer and in started Aloo chat. The hotel is located in Bur Dubai near burjuman centre a busy tourist spot. Location is very accessable to the main market Meena bazaar

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel - do not try it for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: savethetigerkol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights when I was in Dubai on business in the end of October . My pick up at the airport aws a disaster - the pick up guy from the hotel was supposed to pick up somebody else also and after 45 minutes when I told this guy I would be taking a cab he grudgingly agreed to take me to the hotel . Check in was quite slow and tedious and finally I landed in my room which was supposedly an executive one . While it was apacious in nature the upkeep could be definitely better . However at the price of 450 AED I feel it was okay and the view at night was nice . Breakfast buffet spread was quite big though quantity outscored quality . Did not have the chance to have dinner at the hotel . Overall a very average business hotel - certainly not one to stay for a family holiday .

Reviews.Title: “BUSINESS TRIP”
Reviews.Author: AandAW
Reviews.Content: Business trip in Oct. Hotel is easily accessible from the airport and a 25 UAED taxi journey. Fairly standard average business hotel. Large rooms with average facilities (cheap toiletries, slightly tired bathrooms). Good sized comfortable bed. Breakfast buffet very average. Lunch buffet much better. Indian restaurant was good quality. Bar full of ladies of dubious virtue and thus attracts slightly seedy male clientele. Better off on the roof terrace for an evening drink, but beware, drinks overprioced as always in these type of hotels. Staff a mixed bunch, varying from friendly and helpful to surly and a chore. Wifi poor (but free). Located in a drab nondescript area, a walk or taxi to get anywhere. Overall it was fine and I will end up using it again as it one of the hotels on the Dubai list for the firm. However, I would not go there as a private tourist and was surprised to see so many package groups staying there. Not ideal if you want to visit the limited sights of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the reception were not cooperative”
Reviews.Author: YoYoRiffa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Oct 2010. I need to raise a couple of disappointments abut this hotel. First of all i booked to stay at this hotel to attend a course with GLOMACS and they booked for me a single room. when i enter the rooms its like a cave.. it was so small even the toilet when i enter the door was hitting the sink because of the size of the toilet. Also, when i tried to connect to the internet there was a problem with the net socket and when i complained no one pay attention and they kept giving excuses. I asked to change my room to another one but the reception staff claimed there is no vacancies and the hotel fully booked. After three days i went to reception manager and raised my complain with big shouting and anger he took immediate action and shifted me to another room. when i told him how come they have vacancies while they staff told me there is no vacancies he just kept quiet, which means the staff were lying. one disadvantage of this hotel was the lobby is so crowded of hotel guest because of free wifi in the lobby.The food was fine for breakfast and lunch. overall i wont stay at this hotel again because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but wireless internet is terrible”
Reviews.Author: NG2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business recently. The rooms are large and comfortable. They do not have much of a view. The food is good but the service is average. The internet connection specially through wireless is pathetic. The meeting rooms are very nice with lot of natural light. The big complaint I have was their insistence to charge for the full night even when I checked out at 7:30 pm. I found that as very bad business practice. This will prevent me from going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “not a friendly business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sidhantjatia
Reviews.Content: was on a business trip the hotel is great staybut not business friendly as the business center is just three computers no fax no printers have to go the lobby and ask them to use it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad value but the services could be better !”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-reviews-byMT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dhow palace for couple of nights during the Arabian Travel Market and our stay was not purely business but would say it was both for leisure and business. This is a four star hotel with clean rooms. Breakfast was not so great. Not much choice available for breakfast. Staff were formal and less friendly. Nice roof top swimming pool and spa with good service. Do not use hotel taxis as they do not tell you it is private taxi and it is not metered. Although it may be bit luxurious , you will end up paying much much more than the normal taxis.Taxis are readily available so better to wait for a couple of minutes . The hotel has nice Indian restaurant where we had dined before and provided live music but did not get chance to experience it on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “I liked its cleanliness"”
Reviews.Author: Sherina00
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, bedsheets changed everyday, clean shower, quiet environment (for me who loves my sleep - I stayed on 6th floor) BUT the staff were not friendly... they were too stiff for my liking. What happened to "serving with a smile"?! Would I recommend anyone to go to Dhow Palace hotel? Definitely YEA. Much as the staff were not visibly happy, again they were not rude. Since I had not gone to visit the staff and they did not interfere with my schedule, I will pay this hotel another visit but with company so that I don't feel lonely and out of place

Reviews.Title: “Bless the Dhow Palace”
Reviews.Author: cindersBlackpool
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel since it opened 5 years ago It is getting a little jaded but the Staff are wonderful…… everyone is so sweet and kind. They always anticipate your needs and know which room you like. The rooms are really large try to get to the front of the hotel….these bedrooms have the best views. They have tried to upgrade the swimming pool and it works The Dhow is in a great location to get to both sides of Dubai Carol Frend

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Tourist”
Reviews.Author: unfortunatetourist
Reviews.Content: Hi, my name is Carlos. I come from Valencia, my first visit to Dubai was sucha horrible experience due to the Dhow HOTEL!! I arrive at the hotel and i go to the reception and they tell me that I have no room booked under my name, so we had to wait three hours until they sorted it out and They realised that we have booked and paid in advance weeks ago. I arrived in the room, with my handicapped youngest brother and all of a sudden I see him playing with (sorry to say that) a used contrecetive with still spermatoza in it! I was so shocked by the scene! I called the reception and they denied the incident and said that its my disabled 5 year old brother who had made this mess!!! :S I can't believe what they said, as they have not even bothered to apologize or make this up to us! I shall say no more... I was so offended, and I hope that u shall not suffer and ur handicapped bros or siss from what I have suffered. With love from Spain, Carlos! Besos

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Travelman192
Reviews.Content: I was in dubai on a short business trip, my travel agency recomended this place because of its location near my meetings. I regretably listened to tge suggestion. After arriving first night i ordered room service and to my disgust found long black hair in my sandwich. I complained and they brought a replacement, with a TOTALY different food. To top it off i found a used condom in the toilet corner. I checked out and to my horror they charged for both meals, Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Change of hotel manager means lower standards”
Reviews.Author: DAH66
Reviews.Content: I first visited this hotel in March 2010 when it was being managed by British Hotel Manager and was very impressed with the standards and service, the manager was always around and happy to help guests. I visited again this year to find that he was no longer there and boy how things have changed! The attention to detail, standards and attitude of the staff have really gone downhill and we never saw any signs of the manager, not sure I will return again as the atmosphere has totally changed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MaxAlexander
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel. Let me say that the quality of the hotel comparing to its reasonable price was extremely acceptable. Rooms were clean and the lunch buffet was really perfect to my eyes. The only thing to mention is that the swimming pool of the hotel was not really big enough to go when it is crowded.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF AND HOTEL VERY GOOD FOR SEEING DUBAI”
Reviews.Author: john1954187069
Reviews.Content: Hotel very good no problems with the room or the staff. rooms changed every day. back of the hotel is a bit shady in the week with a night club for the business people who stay at the hotel, with exotic dancers and prostitutes ( most hotels are the same in Dubai ), but don't really interfere with the running of the hotel. taxi's are cheap but must stress do not use the hotel taxi's, which are expensive, many local taxi's stop outside. if you can stand the heat the metro station is only 15 minutes away, which is very cheap for seeing most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to see more than "just" the tourist places”
Reviews.Author: Chris_82547
Reviews.Content: Very good location within walking distance to the metro and, if you've got some time, all the way to the creek. You can explore the are north of the hotel and experience a nice, non-tourist part of town away from the newer and / or tourist areas. But it's also nice an centeral to those parts as well. There were always taxis at the front, so that was a option if it was to hot for teh walk to the metro. Nice quiet hotel with good, clean rooms. The pool on the roof is of a reasonable size and a nice place to relax. I will defenitely consider staying there again on my next trip. The only bad point : No free WLAN in the rooms (you can get internet , but the pricing is silly. Come on! It's 2011! This should be included....)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: DubaivisitorDubai
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the worst hotel in all of Dubai. People at the front desk were very rude. Food at breakfast was sub standard. Total rip off. No free wi fi. All the staff seems very unhappy. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference facilities”
Reviews.Author: hemant_i
Reviews.Content: In my trip to Dubai last February, I have used the Banquet and conference facilities at Dhow Palace and I must say they are at par with some of the best hotels in the world. They have many rooms available to chose from, depending on the number of people attending, the services and support provided before and during the conference was really good. The technical staff is a bit weak but the other aspects more than make up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for its Price”
Reviews.Author: SameerBansal
Reviews.Content: Dhow Palace is a Big Hotel in Dubai. The best feature is that hotel staff comes from various cultures and can cater to tourist from different languages...Rooms are decent cant be termed as best....another amaazing feature is lavish breakfast ...egg counter is amazing ...and prepration is hygenic and delicious. Hotel also has an award winning indian restraunt and a dance bar ...so all in all post travel one can shake a leg and enjoy the environment in hotel itself. hotel is located near to Bur Juman Mall and also has free shuttle to important malls and beach park which is a relief for first timers... Though given the value for money proposition its slightly crowded and noisy ...however an excellent proposition for business travellers or families

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Dubai look for this hotel excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Friends67
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel excellent location very friendly staff . pickup and drop off to airport.. free servic to city cente ,beach and other ammenties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mnihal
Reviews.Content: Great property with the room was huge, nice interiors and excellent. The property also has many facilities like Gym, Sauna and Steam and they were outstanding. Especially the view from gym. Also, when I traveled to Dubai, i had rented a car so the hotel staff was so kind to assist with the parking in the basement, that was really convenient. The main part is its Location, which is very good and good value for money... Overall its a good property to stay at. the internet is weak, must go to lobby to use internet

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: katepet
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean spacious room, friedly staff, good breakfast, near to the metro station Al Karama.

Reviews.Title: “Will lie to cover thier tracks”
Reviews.Author: Pnguyen10
Reviews.Content: I was told that someone "hacked" their computer system and that they would not honor Hotels.com pricing. I had to pay the difference directly to the hotel. They said that alot of people had the same issue. They were not sympathetic. I asked what did other people do or what did you offer to others, and they said people can take it or leave it. I tried asking for an upgraded room for my trouble, and they "gave" me an upgrade. I checked online when I got home, and they gave me the lowest priced room; it was not an upgrade. The regular rate at this hotel does not equate to the star rating. This place is overated. Go elsewhere. I wanted to help local businesses, but buyer beware. Next time, I'm going to stick to big name hotel chains in Dubai. Also Valet takes forever.

Reviews.Title: “nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: AditiTandon
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Dubai. Dhow palace, as my agent told me, was a 4* hotel - pretty elegant in looks and style - very centrally located to all malls and attractions. the hotel has a good breakfast option and very beautiful and huge rooms. Overall Dhow Palace was a pleasurable stay for us. I was with my parents, both 50+ and they s both were very comfortable and happy with the hotel. The hotel location was good enough to get a taxi, payphones or some food stuff very conveniently. I would definitely stay again at this hotel during my next trip to Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Consistent service and quality; good location in residential area”
Reviews.Author: JES006
Reviews.Content: Nice airport pickup after long trip; book it online for 75 dh. Juice served at check in is a nice touch. Have stayed 5 years in a row and it stays consistent in good quality. This was a 6 night trade show visit. Prices have come down as befits a struggling economy. Upgraded to Admiral room but still not sure what that means vs a normal room. Explanations are short and I did not ask when checking in. Free internet this time but maybe this is the benefit of the Adm room? No complaints here and the bed really was nice, not hard. Bath robe and towels quite a nice touch. Room is large, tea/coffee stand, large couch and side chair are super. Did not use the restaurants and was out of the hotel much of time due to business. Neighborhood offers many restaurants near Al Karama and Burjuman metros, and on Mankool Rd. Just near the hotel there is nothing near 100 meters; more of a 5-10 min walk. Metro is awesome to get me to Trade center. It is low cost and clean and well designed. The hotel does what I need and still offers good service. I like the size and facilities and good location. Many newer apartment – hotels have come up very near by, which are worth a look for lower cost. I am satisfied with Dhow Palace, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good banquet hall facilities for conference”
Reviews.Author: 1keybi
Reviews.Content: Traveled for CIO conference for 3 nights. We had good experience staying at the hotel with good large rooms. We had good Indian food out there on all days inculding good breakfasts. Their hotel staff helped us setup our few standees and manage logistics for our conference participation materials. The hotel had arranged the sighseeing one evening for desert safari and we enjoyed that a lot. They have a good lounge bar which remain busy till wee hours. Little costly though. There is next door convinience store which can be of help for most of the needs.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect 4*hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagar_101014
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Dubai after completing my Europe tour,I was quiet sure that Dubai's hotels will not be as fascinating as Europe's were,but !!!!! I was totally surprised when we arrived at Dhow Palace This hotel is no less than a 5* hotel.The hotel has been well furnished,the rooms give a feeling of total royalty...whats more ...I truely recommend this hotel to those who wish to go to Dubai......

Reviews.Title: “Elegant looking hotel in a quiet neighborhood - Available at good rates”
Reviews.Author: my_traveler
Reviews.Content: At the time I booked the Dhow Palace I was looking for a good quality hotel with a pool and good evaluations from TripAdvisor at reasonable rates. Let's see whether I was successful: Location: ======= The hotel is located on Kuwait Street, somewhat in „no man’s land“ between the “old city center” and the financial district with its beaming skyscrapers, including Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world. It is easy to get to and from DXB airport, the taxi fare is around 25 Dirham / AED (= 7 USD or 5 EUR). An alternative would be to take the metro that departs from DXB airport. That would only cost around 5 AED but you have to walk from either Karama or Khalid Bin Al Waleed metro station (near the upscale Burjuman shopping center) to the hotel, which could take you almost half an hour (and during the extremely hot summer months is absolutely NOT advisable). Of course you could also take a taxi from Khalid Bin Al Waleed metro station to the hotel at 10 AED. So you would wind up paying 15 AED, including the ticket for the metro from the airport to Khalid Bin Al Waled station. In all you would save around 10 AED or 3 USD and you have to decide whether it is really worth the trouble. I recommend simply taking the taxi: not that much more expensive and more convenient. The situation could change however in March 2011 with the opening of the new airport (DWC), the world’s largest which is located pretty much outside the urban area. The surroundings of the hotel are not very inviting: There’s hardly anything interesting within 10 to 15 walking minutes. The only halfway interesting point of interest at night for me was the music room at the Majestic hotel, a live music venue. Otherwise you have to take the taxi (or take the metro if you’re inclined to walk to either one of the two stations of the “green line”) to get anywhere interesting. Facilities: ======= The hotel pool looked very nice on the Internet and was actually one factor for me to book the hotel. However I was totally disappointed. The hotel pool is located on the roof of the hotel, no sunshades, very small pool area and so on. In short: If you intend to spending some quality time by the pool at the Dhow Palace than forget booking a room here. The breakfast room was very beautiful, stunning! So was the reception area and the lift. On one of the upper floors there was a small business area with computers with internet access. Didn’t really impress me. WiFi is available also. The Indian night club / lounge called Mehendi offered a more, well, exotic (to put it that way) experience with young women dancing to very very loud Indian pop music to a small crowd of male Arabian guests, drinking vodka or water. The entertainment starts at around 11 PM and continues until the wee hours. Interesting, to say the least. I wouldn’t bring kids or even your wive necessarily to this club however. The Queens Quays bar is half Irish pub, half American sports bar. They serve the usual beer brands as well as other alcoholic drinks from 6.30 PM on. Food too is available there. Staff was very nice and friendly. Recommended. Service: ====== The majority of the staff was OK: Reception people, bar staff, nightclub bouncers, doormen: all were nice and helpful. Only exception maybe was one of the concierges who was useless. Rooms: ====== Nicely furnished standard rooms. Mine had a view to the neighboring hotel, so not really too exciting. Bed mattress, pillows, kingsize bed: everything was lovely! Plasma TV with fair selection of international TV stations. The size of the room was also good. Nice desk, chairs, safe and so on. The bathroom floor wasn’t spotlessly clean, unfortunately. Otherwise cleanliness was not an issue, but that bathroom floor is still on my mind. Rating: ===== The hotel’s website boasts a five star rating (9/15/2010) but on the entrance of the hotel there are only four stars under the hotel logo. I’d say 4 stars are appropriate for the Dhow Palace. At 205 AED / night (without breakfast) that I’ve paid, that’s around 55 USD or 43 Euros, the hotel was a good deal in my mind. Summary: ======== A hotel in a quiet neighborhood not too far away from the (old) airport with a stylish interior, nice rooms, good bars and restaurants and available at good rates already. Would I book the hotel again? Possibly. But maybe next time I look for a hotel in a bit more "interesting" area with a real pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Stopover”
Reviews.Author: MissyQw8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night en route to Australia. We chose this hotel for its proximity to shopping and the metro. Also we got a great deal on the web.On arrival we were greeted warmly, and the check-in went without a hitch. Our room was spotless, well appointed and quiet. We dined in the Indian restaurant that night and enjoyed the food and entertainment. Next morning we availed of the inclusive breakfast buffet. Over all we had a pleasant stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Room, Acceptable Service”
Reviews.Author: aztabrizi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in one of the best locations. A few minuts from Metro station. It's not too far from Dubai Mall, Emirates towers, Also it's only 20Dhs (around 5.5$) by taxi to Mercato. We went to swimming pool on the roof and there were a small but nice swimming pool. The stuff was friendly and service was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt get what was promised”
Reviews.Author: DawnySouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dhow Palace on the way out to New Zealand. We stayed for 2 nights and had booked an admiral room. Excellant pick up from the Airport, excellant service at reception on the day of arrival. Did not eat in the hotel as on the first night we were tired but had a few drinks in the bar. Thy allow smoking in the bar so coming from the UK it was quite smokey. Day 2 had to check in for the flight to NZ. Was promised by the hotel that our rate included free internet, comp fruit in the room, comp cocktails and canapes. When I mentioned this to reception they know nothing about it and at first I did not argue as I needed to book in on line to save leaving early in the morning. The computers are on the top floor but no printer so had to go back downstairs to see how I could print out boarding passes. In the end went back to reception with a copy of my confirmation re the fruit, etc and asked if they could help me with the boarding passes. They just said that if i wanted "Happy hour" I had to go to the bar now. The bar didnt know anything about "Happy hour" but did get free drinks for over an hour, no canapies (nuts on the bar) - still go nothing to eat in the hotel (had had a large lunch in the dubai Mall) but we did get fruit delivered to the room. Had to leave the hotel earlier than we wanted to check in at the airport!!! Go to NZ on a regular basis and would stop in a beach hotel if stopped off in Dubai. Nothing really walkable in this location. Good value if you get a good online rate, not worth their rack rates. again, nothing had ral problems and When I asked about in

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: babkirk1
Reviews.Content: I went for 3 days and enjoyed my hotel and the city so much I stayed for 5. Everything, from room, customer service and food was exceptional. I am very fussy and would stay here anytime. If someone complained about customer service, I am shocked and expect it had more to do with the travelor than the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, enjoyable stay~”
Reviews.Author: berriberry
Reviews.Content: Staff have been friendly and helpful. Guest room was large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast has been great! Shuttle buses available to the beach and shopping centre every morning. Location was quite accessible, with supermarket, restaurants and malls nearby, though a bit hot if you decide to walk~~ Nice and enjoyable stay o nthe whole. I will definitely go back in my next trip to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “execellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: mehul84
Reviews.Content: its a good hotel, rooms are very spacious, expensive hotel, breakfast has lots of items...has a many restaurants...overall a good experience.....service needs a little improvement, there is a complimentary bottle of water everyday i believe which comes only after we ask for it.....

Reviews.Title: “open doors/insecure”
Reviews.Author: rg_ldh
Reviews.Content: stayed there from 21-24 may, first nyt small room ,2nd nyt shifted to better room,left hotel at 6.10 pm (3rd day),returned back at around 9pm....i c my room door opened.duty manager came ,just put some device in d key system, nothing happened .i felt insecure staying there.they have so many close circuit cameras what for?.guess just dummies

Reviews.Title: “About Dhow Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hettie4fun
Reviews.Content: Booked via http://www.booking.com Very nice suite, great view, super bed, full breakfast, rooftop swimming pool, very beautiful Central location in Dubai, easy for visiting old Dubai, Bastakiya, Jumeirah, Dubai Creek, Sheikh Zayed Road

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Frank Bruce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped at Dhow Palace for 5 days in March 2010 prior to travelling onto Australia & New Zealand. We found the area very quiet although close to main highway. The hotel is spotless clean and is very well managed. Nothing is a problem to the staff. If you can upgrade to an Admiral room, it is well worth the extra, as this also includes airport transfers, and full breakfast which makes a big difference. I have rated location as 4 but this was not a problem as taxis are readily available and not expensive. Towels are supplied for sitting round pool area. Hotel also has sauna and steam room. We will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at bur dubai !”
Reviews.Author: atishay78
Reviews.Content: It is located at Bur Dubai. It is one of the finest 4 star hotels in Dubai. It is value for money for a stay at a luxury hotel. I stayed at this hotel as I had a stop over form Cape Town - South Africa. I was there for 2 nights. I had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. The staff was very helpful. The restaurant Mamacitas serves mexican food. The quesadillas, enchiladas and tacos were delicious. It also has a live band performance at dinner time. It has a great spa and a rooftop swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to airport and Dubai Shopping Mall”
Reviews.Author: MazzaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Very Formal Hotel - probably better suited to business - Reception and Conceirge both very formal and not friendly. Rooms very nice and large Breakfast Excellent Swimming Pool area very basic - not really for a leisure break - very strange sun beds Do not use the hotel taxi - costs one third extra to the metered taxis that are everywhere - very easy to get a meter taxi if you go out of the back of the hotel and left towards the Sheraton - loads of taxi Good hotel for business but except staff to be friendlier at receiption when on a leisure trip

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: magiciansgirl66
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel an ideal base for both shops and beach, within a 15 minute taxi ride of either. The hotel offers a courtesy bus to the beach and has a very warm pool on the roof! The fitness centre is well equipped and generally quiet so great for a peaceful workout. The rooms were very clean and water was supplied daily. We ate breakfast in the Docklands' restaurant and always very good. The bar area was disappointing and in need of updating to match other hotels in the area but o.k for a quick drink! Overall, the staff could not do enough to help and always on hand to grab a taxi (go with the government taxis and significantly cheaper than the private ones).

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Soul”
Reviews.Author: Rory K
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable rooms but designed for recreational rather than business use - lighting could be better. Colleague had internet problems in room and had to use business centre - not convenient. Dining options very limited so ate elsewhere. Friendly desk/bell staff and good value for money but somehow cannot see myself staying there again. There was no buzz at all.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: delroy Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I agree with the comments that this is NOT a five star hotel!! However, we were given FIVE star treatment throughout!! We arrived six hours before we were due to be given our room, but they decided to release the room early and upgrade us. The room service was very good and we were replenished with water every day. If requested they gave us additional water. The cleaning was excellent and the beds were extremely comfortable. Yes, i agree that the breakfast could become repetitious, but for a short break it offered good value and choice. The hotel is centrally located . It is on Kuwait road which is approx 1/2 mile from the main monorail station and main attractions. I will definately recommend and revist this excellent 'four' star hotel if i return to Dubai. Only one negative: The windows near regular cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great location”
Reviews.Author: ishlondon
Reviews.Content: I don't know which Dhow placae hotel the guy who reviewed this hotel, and complained about the hookers stayed in, but it was not this one. This a superb hotel, we arrived almost a day early, and had booked a captains suite, we were upgraded to the larger Commodre suite, and WOW what a big hotel room, 2 bathrooms, living room, dinning area, and massive bedrom, with spa bath. The spa did not work the first time we tried it, but was fixed with in 2 hours, the location is very central, 15/20 diharam taxi ride to anywhere in Dubai. Great breakfast too. The only slight moan, was the water in the bath was a bit cold

Reviews.Title: “More than WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: SyedRaza
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in Dubai including Radisson, Shangri-La, Rotana, Hyatt besides few more. This time, I was set to stay in Jumeriah Emirates Tower at Sheikh Zaiyd but due to Eid I could not get a confirmation from my favourite website (asiatravel.com) and I booked Dhow Palace virtually 40 minutes before flying off to Dubai. And I am so glad I did! Dhow has clearly offered the best value for my money and is amongst the few hotels that serve great food too. When I checked in, due to eid season, there were lot of guests at the reception but thanks to Mr. Juned Syed (the Duty Manager), check-in was 2 minutes deal all in all. I had booked an Admiral room (720) which was quite spacious, rich in decor and gave a very warm feeling. I was at Dhow for first time and still the staff always greeted me by my name each time I passed by. Ordered room service and loved it, so much that even made a repeat dinner order through the room service. If you have been to Dhow and are not eating in the hotel, you are missing on some of the best kept secret recipes in Dubai. The serving size was amazing, I could not handle it all by myself in one go to be honest. Dhow had a theme of a ship which really makes it different from other “theme-less” hotels. Even the staff is in navy uniform and I wish my kids were accompanying me, they would have really enjoyed it too. I must say from the bell boy to front office to room service to hotel driver DHOW was a very well orchestrated fine music and a smooth sailing. There is something special about DHOW and Captain of the ship (GM) and his entire team deserves to be commended for going really an extra mile in customer delight that I felt each moment of my stay. Location is great, my previous stays were in Sheikh Zaiyed, Marina and one in Deira but the real fun and happening of Dubai down town is where the DHOW is strategically situated (in Bur Dubai). A new space theme park by the name of “Zabeel” for kids has recently been inaugurated (Sep 2009) which is virtually few minutes drive away from Dhow Palace. I finally have found a hotel that I can always come back to in Dubai. Strongly recommend this for families with young and small kids, couples and even solo travelers. Thank you Dhow Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: dmanik
Reviews.Content: Good locations and very central.. Good value for money.. Even though they advertise, this is not a 5 star.. good rooms and food..

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in the main city”
Reviews.Author: mayank_jain30
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel was for 5 days during Aug 08. From the pick up to stya at the hotel my stay was quite smooth. Also the food & the breakfast spread was really good & the best part is that the hotel is near by my office(Standard Chartered Bank). So over all i am pretty satisfied by the hotel services. I am planning my stay again in the same hotel in this month.

Reviews.Title: “Ooops”
Reviews.Author: jiten_nagda
Reviews.Content: Service & Hospitaility in Dubai is pathetic. Room Cleaning is badly done, no water is served during breakfast...... The list is endless

Reviews.Title: “superb food grand lobby”
Reviews.Author: maharajaIndia
Reviews.Content: superb hotel, excellent rooms, nice indian food too

Reviews.Title: “Hotel FAIL. Completely Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: robtlee
Reviews.Content: First time poster and this is a review I felt compelled to write while still staying at the hotel itself. It has been one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. First of all, I am generally pretty laid back about hotels, but enough has happened this week for me to sign up for a Trip Adviser account just to relay my experience. This is NOT, what-so-ever, by far, even in a fairy tale, a Five Star Hotel. If I didn't see it myself I doubt anyone would believe this experience as it seems like something you would only see in a comedy at the movies. Background: We are traveling as a large group with an 80 room block for business travel. I arrived a night early for a 8 night stay. Room: When I first arrived, I walked by the 5 Star rating outside the hotel. I thought I would be impressed. The room they gave me was a box with no windows and with the internet connection not working. Thinking the cable was unplugged from the wall, I went behind the desk and found an open box of condoms. They quickly upgraded me to the only side of the hotel that actually has nice rooms (the front) and apologized. Room was nice, but the cleanliness of the room left much to be desired. But at least the internet worked at blazing fast speeds of 56KB per second. Restaurants: Half of the restaurants are closed. They website lists six, but all are closed except Docklands, the Italian place, the Indian place, and the bar. They even list signs to these restaurants and their operating times in the lobby on an electronic display. Clearly this hotel has zero attention to detail if you cannot even delete the restaurants from your electronic screen placed at the front of the hotel. Internet and Business Center: They charge you $27 a day to use the internet at speeds slower than a 56KB modem. Completely and utter rip off. We tried to “rent” a projector but they said we could only buy one instead. In the hotel book it says "A/V equipment can be rented at our Business Center. Please contact our Business center to arrange your requirements." We called back and mentioned this and again they said they could only have us purchase a projector. Finally, we had to print pages for a business report, I asked where the nearest Kinkos/FedEx or printing location was. *blank stares from the staff* They finally printed it themselves and charged approximately $1 USD per page. Concierge: Complete Clown Show. First, When we first arrived they pointed us to a bar a 10 minute walk from the hotel that was full of prostitutes as "the place to go" that is close to the hotel. Second, I tried to get several tour bookings through them and even tried to set up a golf tee time. Each time the "concierge" handed the phone to me and I had to talk myself to make the bookings. I finally gave up. Others in our group had similar incompetent experiences with the concierge. It was joked that they might have trouble booking us a glass of water through their own room service. Security: First story: When locked out of my room, I had to get a new key. I went up to front desk and asked for a new key. They gave me one without asking for an ID. Second story: This is might be a five star hotel if you are a sex tourist perhaps. It seems the ladies just walk up to your room and come on in. To make matters even more comical, one of my business partners had two prostitutes ask for the key to their room at 3 AM because they had left something in the safe the night before. They walked in on the sleeping woman and woke her up to have them check the safe. She took a photo just to prove she was not making up the story. She later found out that the ladies handed out a room key without ID. To test the theory, two days later, she went up to the front desk and directly asked for the key to hey room from a new manager. The manager started to hand over the key without checking for ID, until she asked if they were forgetting something. Final story, While having beers late one night, the “night club” they had downstairs clearly had some very colorful individuals walk through the hotel. Location: Horrible. Construction is directly on the right side of the hotel. Most of the rooms have zero view if they have a window at all. The location, as we found out, is in a more seedy area of the city. To get to Atlantis or downtown the cab drivers knew where to go better than the cars and drivers that the hotel used. They looked nice and the cars were better than cabs, but each time I was in one of the cars, I questioned if the driver really knew where we were going. In one instance, he dropped us off ¼ mile away from the location we asked him to drop us off at. Straw that broke the camel’s back): Having come back from a business tour, I headed across the street to Burger King with a friend and we came back to the hotel. Sitting on one of the tables in the lobby not associated with any restaurant we were relaxing eating our food. The head manager walked up and asked us if we were guests and asked us to take our food to our rooms as outside food was not allowed in the lobby. I wouldn’t have said anything, but I felt that this hotel had too many problems for this to be a true concern and they did not have any signs posted. He proceeded to argue with me even though I had asked that they make an exception. Completely flabbergasted we both headed to our rooms after having been scolded like we were in high school by the manager. Is this truly how they treat their paying guests? Final verdict: Between complete lack of customer service, location, value, security, and general feeling the entire week, I would give this hotel one star. Why one star? They at least had working toilets. Do not come to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliness and theme”
Reviews.Author: Mimib79
Reviews.Content: Great service, beware of offers for Desert Safari outside the hotel. I would advise booking that with a company like Arabian Adventures who we booked with through Emirates. They did airport pick up and drop off which was very convenient. The actual rooms in the hotel are spacious and the room service is excellent. There are 6 restaurants but didn't even get time to try them as there was sooo much to do. The gift shop has reasonable souvenir prices and breakfast was buffet with a good variety of hot and cold food.

Reviews.Title: “BAD experince”
Reviews.Author: Haaaz
Reviews.Content: it was the worst hotel i ever stayed in... the room had no window! it was simply like jail... plugs ( electrical and internet) were not working! when we complained none bothered! dont ever think of using it

Reviews.Title: “A bit ropey”
Reviews.Author: other1
Reviews.Content: Tired, a bit grubby. Unambitious 'dhow' themed / gaudy interior adds to the overall unpleasantness. Public areas feel a bit civil service.

Reviews.Title: “Good with Some Bad Points”
Reviews.Author: Faylasof
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business for 7 nights. I booked for a deluxe room and they kindly upgraded my room to the admiral room. The rooms are clean but the decor of the room and bathroom was not that good. The view was not good too. Most of the staff were friendly. The swimming pool was under maintenance (roof top). The location is in a relatively quiet place. The major problem was finding taxis especially from 5 to 8 PM. which was really annoying. Bur Dubai is in the middle between Deirah and other parts of Dubai. Compared to the high rate (~1700 Dh), I think one can find much better hotel but the business event I attended took place in this hotel and the transportation in Dubai is clearly a problem, I had to stay there. So if you have a car and got a better rate than I had, then it'll be OK to stay in this hotel. Otherwise, better spend money on other much better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SolyTehran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dhow Palace for a week, very good hotel considering the price. The only problem is getting a Taxi. There are hotel taxis available all the time but they are very expensive. If you had any problem go directly to the duty manager we found this very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GemandFido
Reviews.Content: Extremely cheap, all the staff were friendly, the breakfast was lovely, I mean lovely. I dont know why all these people are saying its hard to get a taxi becuase as soon as you approach the hotel entrance the staff run out in the road an get one on your behalf - so thats rubbish, that service was great. The rooms were lovely, A/C was good, the cleaner came 3-5 times a day, towels replaced daily and water. The hotel was very nice. The POOL, this is the only disapointing factor, its small, really small, and you have to pay room service prices at the pool. All the staff were so friendly. No tea or coffee facilites in room though. The oriental restaurant in the hotel is one of the best I have ever been to, they cannot do enough for you - fantastic. There is a bus facilty to Jumeriah and Emirates Mall, but I got the impression the hotel does not like to tell guest that (free of charge). I would stay there again, no problem, but would go to the hotel direct as we paid 499AED per night and our friend who walked in from the street was quoted 1999AED per night (and its certainly not worth that)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Travelchamp6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dhow Palace hotel for a week in June 2008. Relatively new hotel with good amenities...Everything in a standard 5 star hotel. Nothing to complain about. However, it would have been nice to have a tea/coffee maker in the room..Two complimentary bottles of water every day was very welcome. If you plan to stay at the Dhow Palace, you would need to set aside additional funds for travel as Dubai taxis are very difficult to come by. If you take the hotel taxis you would have to pay double the fare charged by Dubai Taxis,,,but this is a small price to pay considering you are in a Desert Enviro and at times impossible to walk on the streets due to the heat...The Hotel Help desk are very accomodating and the Food at Docklands was very nice...Try the Steak house too for good steaks..

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: irfaan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 nights and the hotel was pleasent, it gave value for money, there was a vast choice of food in restraunts. Service was excellent, i didnt encounter any problems and the staff were very friendly and helpful. To catch a taxi , we found it easy to catch them from the rear exist across the road, but there are private taxi's which are part of the hotel which are a bit more costly then the public ones but you get a more luxury transportation. The rooms were cleaned and bedding changed 2 times a day Rooms are a bit dark but we were hardly in the rooms so it wasnt an issue. 10mins walk from burjuman mall, bad point - there is construction starting next door-, so make sure you let the reception know you want to be on the other side of the building. swimming pool is tiny. Overall I had a good experience in dhow palace hotel and it provided a good 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: zareeney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our stopover from Maldives back to San Francisco. The only positive remark that I have about this hotel is the food. Tons of choices and the in room dining was delicious. If anyone has ever traveled to Dubai you know that the times are really erratic for flights leaving and arriving etc. We had a stopover on the way to the Maldives and on the way back. Our first stopover the experience was wonderful because the hotel that we stayed at allowed us to checkin early at around 8 am and without us even requesting an upgrade or telling us they were unable to accommodate us at this time (because they didn't have the room category that I paid for available) upgraded us so we could rest. Most hotels in Dubai will accommodate you but this hotel on the other hand is a real stickler for checkin and checkout times. The lady at the desk was so outrageously rude to other members of the staff in front of us, that I was actually appalled. Then she wasn't pleasant to us either. After grumbling about the fact that we were here early all she could is give us a room is a lower category. We were like fine it doesn't matter because we just needed to rest for a 3-4 hours and then leave. The room she gave us had no windows so it felt like a jail. Very small to the point that our bathroom door wouldn't open all the way because it was hitting the toilet. A design issue? I think so. Room Itself: I just felt gross being inside the room. There was funny smell to it, the lights were dim in a room that already felt claustrophobic due to no windows. I have no idea who gives hotels their official rating because hands down this is not a five star hotel. I repeat absolutely not a five star hotel. Can't stress that point enough and it wasn't cheap either. If I was to compare it to a hotel in the United States it is probably more on the likes of a La Quinta maybe, 2 to 2.5 stars at best. The rating for this hotel should be revised. The only reason we stayed there is the first place was because we wanted to be closer to the airport. Big Mistake and will not be staying there ever again and please take the reviews of this hotel seriously, It is truly not a five star hotel in any category except for food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but .....”
Reviews.Author: jus_rub
Reviews.Content: Our family has just back from Dubai for my husband business trip. We got viceroy suite. Roomwise it's so HUGE ( with capital letters ) and it's very beautiful. It's 100sqm, with separate dining and living room, 1 outside toilet and a jetted tub in inside bathroom. However, I feel that it's a little bit untouched. When we checked the room for the first time, some lamps were not working, the TV set in the living room wasn't working, the toilet spray was leaking. But they fixed it right away the next morning. Breakfast were fine. No complaint about it. Al Madina supermarket is just 2 minutes away to the left. We can get pretty much everything, including my infant milk. The first and major but is taxi. Definitely an issue. This hotel is situated in the quiet road, you will need some time to get a taxi. Just make sure you look around and check who's standing there before you. On our 3rd day, one hotel guy with black suit cut our line twice. It seems that he wanted anyone who asked him for a taxi got a taxi first. And thinking those who only asked a bellboy can wait. The second but was the room service. Only tried once. It took them more than 1 hour to prepare a sandwich at 10 pm. The strangest thing, they have menu option from hotel restaurants, not separated menu, but it's clearly inside the room service menu. But when we tried to order that, they say no. We just can choose for room service a la carte. The million dollar question is why they have the restaurants menu on their room service menu then ? The next but is the hotel swimming pool. It's on the rooftop and very small. So it's a little bit packed on the evening. I think that's all I can say about this hotel. It's still a nice hotel to stay. Even with 2 kids. But next time, maybe a beach hotel will be a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean rooms, impossible to get a taxi”
Reviews.Author: JohnLLondon
Reviews.Content: A nice clean newish hotel in Bur Dubai well placed for the trade centre on business. If you were going for leisure it is more likely you would choose a beach location anyway. The rooms are large 40 sq metres and the service is excellent. There are 6 food outlets but I did not get the chance to try any of them, but they seemed good. Reception staff are generally good but english not always that great. Beware if you want an early check in time as I had to wait an hour at 10am before the room became available. It is difficult for taxis to stop at the hotel thus incurring waits everytime you want one. A good 4 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very central”
Reviews.Author: tr4v3lbug
Reviews.Content: http://www.dhowpalacedubai.com/ This hotel is superb, had a great stay with my family. The location is very central and you can walk around the city centre shopping areas. The rooms were really big and nice. Very clean and staff very helpful. The breakfast had loads of variety and something for everyone. The price of hotel is bit on the upper side as in bit expensive but very good service and decor wise. Would recommend others.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: LouisPalmer
Reviews.Content: Haven't been there yet but just got off the phone with them. Am from UK and have made my reservation through Expedia. Just called the hotel to confirm if they did 24 hour check in/out - and they don't. For a 5 star, i expected this to be the norm. Was told i'd have to pay for the extra night if i was to arrive at 5AM. The thing that really put me off was that the telephone operator first put me to someone else to deal with my request, and that person simply transferred me to Bookings, who were closed for the day. Surprise, surprise, there wasn't even a message at the end of the line saying that they weren't available to take the call. The phone just kept ringing. Some 5 star hotel this. Now will have to check the expedia cancellation policy on hotel bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here and found the hotel to be pleasant and reasonably convenient. Our room was very spacious with very high ceilings that gave it an airy feel. There was a sofa and two sitting chairs as well as a desk. The bath was a bit small compared to the rest of the room, but the shower was good and the only complaint I have is that the shower/tub was very narrow making it hard to stand in. The room had decent closet space but could use more hangers. There is a safe in every room. Turn down service was provided nightly. The lobby is very nice and the overall decor is good. There is a bar off the lobby and seven restaurants within the hotel. My experience was with only two and I found the food to be quite good. Everyone I spoke with had high praise for the food. The breakfast buffet selection was very large and the food was of good quality. The rooftop pool is rather awkward to get to, but is quite decent, although somewhat small. There is a charge to use the business center for internet, about $4 US for 30 minutes. I saw a spa and hair salon as well. Now, about calling this a 5 Star hotel - it simply isn't. Just looking at it in comparison to other 5 Star locations such as the Grand Hyatt Dubai makes one realize that some strange rating standard is being used. The Dhow Palace strikes me as a decent 3 1/2 star property geared to business users and I've no doubt that is exactly how it would be rated by US (or rest of the world) standards. The best tip I got came from some of the previous reviews. Use the mini-mart that is less than two blocks away to by sodas and snacks for your room. A 12 ounce can of Coke in the lobby cost 12 Dirham, while two 16 ounce Cokes cost me 4 Dirham in the store. Finally, there is virtually no place you can walk to, so taxis are a must. The hotel, and all the other hotels as well, have metered cars available in place of regular taxis. They are fine and safe, however, the meter rates are about TWICE those of regular taxis. If you are taking a short trip, it is probably worth the convenience, but for longer trips, make the effort to get a regular taxi. We found this out the hard way when we took a hotel car to the Mall of the Emirates and a regular taxi back. The hotel car cost almost exactly twice as much for the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, only minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: I spent one week in the Dhow Palace hotel in Dubai and had a pleasant stay. The hotel seems to be relatively new as I could not discover any wear and tear. My single room was spacious with flat screen tv and well furnished with a queen size bed, a couch, seat, 2 tables, 2 desks with chairs, a bench for the suitcase, a wardrobe and there was enough space left to move in the room without problems. The bathroom was equally large with sink/toilet/bidet/bathtub. Everything was well maintained and clean, the sheets were changed twice during my 1 week stay. I had breakfast at the hotel, everything was on offer catering for western as well as oriental tastes. The staff was very polite, unfortunately not everyone at the hotel speaks english well (some did, others didn´t), therefore just 4 stars from me. If you want to avoid the expensive minibar, there is a supermarket very close to the hotel, when you leave via the main entrance just turn left, its a 2 minutes walk and they store everything you need. The hotel isn´t posh in a Ritz-way, its more like an upper category business hotel and you will see all kinds of folks and nationalities there wearing business suits, track suits as well as folkloric costumes. The Dhow Palace is situated "near" the old part of Dubai but this doesn´t mean its a short stroll to the souks, indeed you have to take a taxi to go everywhere, but then the distances in Dubai are generally large, no matter where you stay and taxi rides are cheap. (for information: a taxi ride from the Dhow Palace to the Mall of the Emirates is 22 km and I always paid about 40 Dirham (ca. 8 Euro) one way. Single female travellers don´t have to worry about walking round unaccompanied in Dubai.Its very safe and I never got harassed or stared at anywhere, not even when I sunbathed on the public beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay For 8 Nights”
Reviews.Author: JES006
Reviews.Content: For 8 nights during an exhibition, things went pretty smoothly. This is my 2nd time here and it becomes familiar. I got a room in the rear - 237, that was extra long. Although not unusual according to the layout map, it was a blessing to have such a large room and very large bath. A higher floor would have been better due to ballroom events/music from the 1st floor just below. This was heard for 3 nights and once I called to the desk which seemed to help the volume at 12.30am, then the next night I stayed up til 2 am doing work. The 3rd night was my last and my flight was very early so I asked to be moved, which was not a problem at all. Breakfast is good and pretty much the same, with some variety day to day. Staff friendliness is basic, not their strong suit but some are better than others; it may be due to quality of English spoken? Taxis are a problem in Dubai esp, during a big exhibition; try the rear exit also as there are many apt buildings in that neighborhood. Restaurant food is quite good and room service is prompt. All in all, a very successful stay for my business needs. Music was only issue.

HotelInfo.Name: Dhow Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Kuwait Street, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
